greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 1/(sqrt(2)*G), where G is Gauss's constant A014549.
comment: Also, decimal expansion of Product_{n>=1} (1-1/(4n-1)^2)). - _Bruno Berselli_, Apr 02 2013
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
P. Bala, Notes on the constants A096427 and A224268
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Gauss's Constant
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ubiquitous Constant
formula: Also equals agm(1,1/sqrt(2)) since agm(1,1/b) = (1/b)*agm(1,b). - _Gerald McGarvey_, Sep 22 2008
mathematica: (* From the comment: *) RealDigits[N[Product[1 - 1/(4 n - 1)^2, {n, 1, Infinity}], 110]][[1]] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Apr 02 2013 *)
program: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=agm(1, sqrt(1/2)); d=0; for (n=0, 20000, x=(x-d)*10; d=floor(x); write("b096427.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Apr 15 2009
(MAGMA) SetDefaultRealField(RealField(100)); R:= RealField(); Gamma(3/4)^2/(Sqrt(2)*Sqrt(Pi(R)/2)); // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 17 2018
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Jul 21 2004
